summary: This is an email from a prosecutor discussing revisions to victim notification language regarding Jeffrey Epstein's non-prosecution agreement. The email addresses concerns from Epstein's counsel and references ongoing litigation about disclosing the agreement to victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement between himself and the United States government.

persons.name: Mr. Josefsberg
persons.context: Referenced as someone who can provide guidance to victims regarding the disclosure of the Epstein agreement.

connections.description: Josefsberg is referenced as a resource for victims regarding the Epstein agreement, suggesting a legal or advisory role in the case.

events.title: Litigation over Epstein Agreement Disclosure
events.description: Ongoing litigation between the United States and two victims regarding the disclosure of the entire non-prosecution agreement between the U.S. and Jeffrey Epstein.

locations.context: Address and contact information for the sender of the email.

keyFacts: Epstein's counsel complained about the original victim notification language regarding the non-prosecution agreement, prompting a revision.
There was litigation between the U.S. and two victims over disclosing the full Epstein agreement.
The court case 'In re Jane Does 1 and 2' (S.D. Fl. Court File No. 08-80736-CIV-MARRA) is referenced as the legal proceeding about the agreement's disclosure.
Victims or their attorneys could review the actual Epstein-U.S. agreement if they agreed to be bound by a Protective Order.
The document shows internal government communication about managing victim notifications and legal concerns in the Epstein case.
